note: Kepler's heliocentric cosmology. The Sun sits at the center as divine architect — planets radiate outward. Each planet carries a musical interval (from Harmonices Mundi), a Platonic solid (from Mysterium Cosmographicum, nested between orbital spheres), a temperament, and an elemental correspondence. Earth replaces the Moon as a planetary body; the Moon orbits Earth and its silver correspondence passes to this level.

Sun.description: Divine architect, father, central source of light and life — permeates all, fertile cause

Mercury.temperament: Sanguine — flickering mind, changeable, clever, cheerful, optimistic, and social

Venus.temperament: Phlegmatic — gentle, smooth orbit, calm, balanced, reliable, and steady

Earth.description: Intellectual soul, celestial harmony, and awakened spiritual resonance
Earth.temperament: Balanced mix — reference point, must integrate all

Mars.description: Assertive, forceful, energetic, and vigorous orbital motion
Mars.temperament: Choleric — vigorous motion, assertive, ambitious, and intense

Jupiter.description: Majestic, expansive, wise, and full of gravitas

Saturn.description: The oldest, the slowest, the most solemn, the deepest — elder voice, time and gravity
Saturn.temperament: Melancholic — introspective, slow motion, deep tone, heavy and distinct

Stars.description: The fixed stars — beyond the planetary spheres
